DOC.brief_summary: This study will evaluate the safety over 6 months of two different doses of vitamin D (cholecalciferol) in men and women age 65 and older. It will also evaluate if supplementation with vitamin D improves physical performance.
DOC.brief_title: Safety of Vitamin D Supplementation in Older Persons
DOC.detailed_description: 120 ambulatory men and women ages 65 to 95 will be enrolled in this study. Each subject will participate in the clinical trial for 6 months. Parathyroid hormone, vitamin D, and serum and urinary calcium will be measured periodically. Physical performance will be tested at baseline and throughout the study.
DOC.criteria: ambulatory hypercalcemia hypercalciuria > 4 mg/kg body weight/day primary, secondary, or tertiary hyperparathyroidism renal insufficiency (serum creatinine > 2 mg/dL ) history of nephrolithiasis treatment with vitamin D (ergocalciferol, cholecalciferol, calcitriol) treatment with anticonvulsants Paget's disease severe cardiac, pulmonary, hepatic, renal, or neurological disease life expectancy < 1 year participation in another trial
